author: matthiasksieber
title: Case Study: Yomi.ai & Ada Pay
description: 既存の中小企業経営者にとって、ADAを支払いとして受け入れる明確なインセンティブはありません。

f6_assessments.q0:
この提案は素晴らしいアイデアであり、課題を解決するためのソリューションを特定しようとするチームの強い試みを示しています。  提案されたソリューションは、COTIとカルダノのパートナーシップを発展させるための明確な付加価値となっています。  さらに、彼らはチャレンジの基準に対して主要な評価基準と目標を調整しただけでなく、彼らが解決しようとしている問題は、ADAに実世界の取引ユースケースを提供するというCardanoの広範なビジョンに合致しています。   

また、このプロジェクトは、実際には拡張可能な実験でもあります。このプロジェクトが成功すれば、同じ設計原理を今後の膨大なユースケースに適用することができます。  今後の提案では、このプロジェクトを「良い提案」から「優れた提案」にするために、実験の潜在的な影響や成果を定量的に示すことをお勧めします。例えば、この実験で「確かな」結果を得るためのベンチマークは何か。  単に測定基準を示すのではなく。このように区別することで、将来的にはより説得力のあるピッチを提供することができるでしょう。
f6_assessments.q1:
実現可能性の観点から見ても、これは素晴らしい提案です。  この提案の強みは、提案者の背景や関連するスキルが透明性をもって示されていることです。さらに、彼らはIOGハッカソンでの受賞を通じて、このエコシステムを理解し、構築する能力があることを示しています。  さらに、チームメンバーの中には、評判が高く、初期のカタリスト・コミュニティのメンバーとして貢献している人もいます。これは、資金調達のプロセス全体と、成功に必要な期待事項をよく理解していることを示しています。

このことは、予算、使用する技術ソリューション、将来的な資金調達の見通しがシンプルかつ明確に示されていることからもわかります。  この提案の最大の特徴は、キャッシュフローのある既存のビジネスモデルで実験を行うことです。  20年以上の歴史を持つこの企業は、Stripeなどの様々な決済手段をすでに試していると思われ、顧客が従来のフィアット通貨から暗号通貨の決済手段に切り替えるために何が必要かをよく理解していると思われます。

懸念事項として挙げられたのは、提案書の「リスク」のセクションで、リスクや課題はないと述べられていたことです。想定される新たなリスク（例え低・中程度のリスクであっても）のリスト（例：サンプル数の少なさ、市場の牽引力の低さなど）と、将来的にそれらに対処するためのソリューションを提示することは良い方法です。
f6_assessments.q2: この提案の主な強みは、ロードマップ、主要な活動の実施予定時期、予算配分の詳細など、重要な情報をシンプルにまとめていることです。さらに、課題の評価基準（例：トランザクションの総試行回数と完了回数の比率）との整合性が明確に示されています。  提案書に欠けている最後の点は、(1)将来の課題（実験後）と、(2)成果の比較に使用される指標のベンチマークを認識していることです。この点の透明性が高まれば、提案（および実験）はさらにレベルアップします。

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal identifies the problem of no clear incentives for small businesses to adopting ADA payments. If successful this will drive adoption for Cardano and it should be able to scale accordingly. The metrics is aligned with the challenge as it focuses on online business payment options.
f6_assessments.q1: Relevant experience and team is presented. Budget is reasonable and broken down into identifiable items and shows that they know what is needed to build  this project. The launch date seems achievable. They describe what languages are used to build the frontend as well as the backend. Going into detail about the architecture and how payments are processed referencing API placement. They claim to not see any potential risks in implementing this. One risk I can see is that certain online businesses will have better results in this study than other online businesses. Will they stop at one study or target other businesses after this one.
f6_assessments.q2: They provided a roadmap with clear identifiable milestones and KPIs based on users and user input are easy to measure the performance of this project. The targeted problem is clearly described and their proposal in a whole is the solution needed to solve this problem. Concise and to the point.
f6_assessments.reply: The impact and specially feasibility rationales don't seem to match the score given.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree that this proposal not only effectively addresses the challenge but also provides a different but important viewpoint for ada pay integration. 

Any solution, including AdaPay, has to have answer to basic question - "What are the benefits for a business owner to move from fiat to Ada via AdaPay ?".

In my opinion this proposal takes a very different approach where the emphasis is on the real use case than the number of ecommerce sites integrations happening. As there are other proposals in here which will cover those use cases, this proposal, if implemented successfully, will help both the  COTI/Cardano eco system  to have a real use case based case study, results of which then can be then propogated to future projects providing AdaPay plugins..
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal has given good and detailed information on the experience of the team. Some of the names are well known already in Cardano community (Project catalyst) and the experience of developers are in sync with the tech stack team proposes for this solution. As a full stack developer myself I have no concerns in ability of the team presenting this proposal.

Additionally, plan is outlined in a very detailed fashion, Tech stack is given in details, which means team already is aware of what needs to be done on implementation side. Furthermore, the budget seems to be very well explained. Since team has good experience, we can see that budget although on a little bit higher side (20% of total challenge settings), the budget distribution and total is justified.

In my opinion, therefore the proposal is perfectly explained and well written, and i strongly agree that likelihood of this proposal being implemented successfully is quite high.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has given a detailed roadmap of the execution plan, which means that community and voters have already a good feeling on when to expect what feature set.

This will allow community to keep the progress tracking and productive feedback loop among the community.

The detailed metrics and "how success looks like?" provides gives good confidence to the community as in to have upfront understanding of what can be expected as a result of successful implementation of this proposal.

These all points, therefore can be easily tracked by community to keep a track on proposal progress as time passes by. 

Therefore , I strongly agree that the information provided in this proposal is sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: A great way of integrating two challenges at once. Integrating ADA pay and helping the Japanese community to connect with the Cardano community. By providing an ADA payment method on a Japanese translating website you get both sides of the coin in this fund. This proposal does not speak to the masses of e-commerce but is rather a case study of how it impacts small businesses and this can surely scale up.
f6_assessments.q1: About the team members in this proposal, they are more than qualified to do this. This is clear because the team consists mostly of members within the community and they are all familiar with the Catalyst project. Also due to the way they give a clear explanation of what the problem is and how they plan on solving it. The roadmap is well explained and in detail. I have full confidence that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Since most members are well aware of what Project catalyst is there is no detail missing in terms of auditability. Not only is a roadmap provided but successes are also mentioned, which is a morale boost for the proposers when reached. This is something that is missing in a lot of proposals but in my opinion a key factor in success. Metrics that are offered give good measures on what to expect of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: I like that the proposal is focused on a single integration, albeit with a very niche platform. If the work is open sourced it could provide useful research and templates for other integrations. However, the specific technical talking points in the COTI challenge are not discussed, and its difficult to know if yomi.ai has sufficient usership to produce meaningful research results or impact.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has wide technical experience and is established in Catalyst ecosystem. The have access to a working marketplace with which to integrate.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget is broken down and some metrics of success are given. This is a combination of research and technical implementation. Assessing the success of the proposal should not be difficult.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal starts with developing ADA Pay solution for Yomi.ai website, which is a Japanese subscription-based website. But this development is not the only objective, as the proposal is mainly about documenting the journey and evaluating the benefit for a small business owner to accept ADA as payment. 
I strongly agree that this project can be valuable to develop ADA as a payment for small businesses.
f6_assessments.q1:
Winwin team members are identified and experienced software developers and deeply engaged in Cardano's environment. This highly experienced team is probably the reason why the proposal states that no risk is identified with implementing this proposal (risk are pre-mitigated) : though I do not know any project without a single risk, so I would recommend the proposer to elaborate on risks and their mitigation.
Considering the highly experienced team, I agree that this proposal is likely to be implemented sucessfuly.
f6_assessments.q2:
Budget is well detailed, 2/3 of the total funding is dedicated to development, and 1/3 to marketing and documentation. Roadmap are is detailed, with a launch expected April 1st 2022.
One axis of the success is the fact that customers actually pay with ADA. But the main interest is the knowledge about whether small business would benefit from an ADA payment option, and the best way to achieve it. This objective is expected in May 2022 with the publication of findings.
The milestones provided are easy to be monitored by the community, and deliverables are expected short term. 
I agree that the community will be able to effectively monitor the progress of this proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: The CA doesn't explain why the proposal only partially addresses the challenge, and we are proposing a usage of DIDs, which is one of the 2 main goals of the challenge.

solution: 小規模なビジネスで、フィアットの受け入れからADAへの移行を説明した事例。
experience: 中小企業経営者、Loxe Inc.チーム、経験豊富でハッカソンで優勝したPlutus開発者グループ、スタートアップ経験豊富なウェブ開発者。
